title: Why am i getting double ping when i stream, and why does the client load slower?
body:
Client seems to be broken (more than I'm used to.) Sometimes i have to open it 3 different times before it even **ATTEMPTS** to open itself.

Everytime i try to stream this game i get 110-112ping, when i dont stream i get 59-62ping...

**EVERY OTHER GAME I PLAY** does not do this, WoW I get 47ping, **and 47PING when i stream,** no difference, any other game i play does not lag either.

Also, I've been complaining about LP gains for a few years now, **and im gonna do it again...**

16-17LP WINS, -17-18LP LOSSES... 54% win rate (low i know,) but people tell me, ITS YOUR MMR, NOT YOUR ELO that u get based off LP...

But that's also wrong, since i play with diamond+ in all norm games, 

Yet I'm forced into gold 2 - plat 4 gameplay in ranked. 

The team game play is INTeresting to say the least in this low elo.

Dunno what to do about these problems, so ill just rant into the void, if u read this, thanks for reading, if you are RIOT and you read this, PLEASE address this.

{{sticker:cass-cry}}

replies.body: LoL uses _far_ more packets and overall data than WoW, chances are you are overwhelming your router or overall connection.

i still dont understand why i get double the ping a few minutes after starting a stream, my net is hardwired to my modem, and i get an average of 205mbps (i pay for the 175mb+ package, but get around 200+ on average).

Thanks for the input.

For the record you are using a Cat5e or better cable correct?
I can't tell you the number of homes I've been into that were using Cat5 or even Cat3 :x

umm, it actually might be only cat5, i havent bought a new cable in a long time, ill have to look into a better cable when i get paid, ty for suggestion.

(EDIT : It is a cat5e, i just checked, its one of the new cables i got from xfinity with my net purchase.)

Sorry my dude, but it's on your end. I have zero client or lag issues on my mid range gaming PC with only 100Mb net out in BFE. I routinely Discord screen-share or record with OBS and never see above 40 ping or FPS drop. I generally have dozens of browsers tabs open (let's be real it's most likely porn) and have no issues as well.

Either it's your PC, your ISP, or the software you are using to stream.

PC : SkyTech Archangel : FX-6300 3.50 GHz 6-Core, GTX 1050 Ti 4GB, 24GB DDR3, Windows 10 Pro 64-bit.

ISP : Xfinity

Stream software : OBS Studio

i7 4770k, GTX 1070, 240GB SSD  a 2TB storage drive, 16GB DDR4, Windows 10 Home.

I think I spent around $890 on it. Was pretty cheap. Went cheap as hell on a lot of components, but TBH I never saw any difference in spending more money on brand names.
why is it only on league though, i dont get it.

I just dont understand this crap at all, when i lived in cali i got 33ms.

Now i live in utah, and im literally 6 hours to denver, and my ping is twice that even though im so much closer to the denver server than i was...
